children.value: Sourcegraph is the standard developer platform for code search and navigation at many of the largest and most exacting technology companies. With Sourcegraph, every company has access to the same kind of tools that Google and Facebook developers use every day.

hProperties.aria-label: Symbol search performant at scale permalink

children.value: View on Vimeo

) is a powerful feature for finding specific symbols, such as a function, variable, or package, and not just all text occurrences of your query. More and more users are taking advantage of symbol search results, which was leading to performance issues for some users with large instances.
Symbol search is now indexed for default branches

, which is a major improvement for both users running symbol searches and admins with large instances that were having performance issues. On large symbol searches, we‚Äôve seen speed ups by factor of 20x (

Upon upgrading, Sourcegraph will seamlessly & automatically re-index repositories in the background. Once finished, you‚Äôll see substantially improved symbol search performance. In the meantime, Sourcegraph will perform as it would normally.

Deployment note

Prior to upgrading, please consult our 3.7.2+ migration guide to ensure you have enough free disk space.

hProperties.aria-label: Search performance efficiency and reliability improvements permalink

children.value: Search performance, efficiency, and reliability improvements
As we continue to make incremental improvements, Sourcegraph search is getting faster, more efficient, and more reliable across the board. In Sourcegraph 3.7:
Symbol search is now performant at scale (see above)
The indexed-search code path, Zoekt, now runs garbage collections twice as frequently, which reduces Sourcegraph‚Äôs memory consumption.
We‚Äôve improved support for Unicode search results, so that

hProperties.aria-label: More accurate TypeScript code intelligence permalink

children.value: View on Vimeo

Out-of-the-box TypeScript code intelligence has been improved with an updated ctags version that includes a built-in TypeScript parser. This means that jump to definition is more accurate for TypeScript files, and the symbols sidebar recognizes more functions and variables with fewer false positives.

hProperties.aria-label: Improved efficiency of Git requests permalink

children.value: We now use Git protocol version 2 with compatible code hosts. This can significantly increase the efficiency and performance of a
by reducing the amount of data transmitted over the wire, especially when Sourcegraph‚Äôs copy is only a few commits behind the remote (a common situation).
As an illustrative example, when Git protocol version 2 is used,
is up to 2x faster and consumes up to 4x less client CPU (averaged across 10 runs on a 2015 MacBook Pro).
for more technical details and performance measurements.

hProperties.aria-label: Multi line n search on all branches permalink

children.value: we introduced the ability to do a multi-line search in
in queries, however, it was limited to only indexed default (e.g.
) branches. In 3.7 we expand this option to include unindexed branches so
you can now perform multi-line searches on any branch
Icons have been added to the language extensions in the extension registry, and will soon be added to the external service extensions, such as Codecov and Sentry.

hProperties.aria-label: Sourcegraph configuration temporary overrides in the UI permalink

children.value: Sourcegraph configuration temporary overrides in the UI
introduced an optional way to load Sourcegraph configuration from a file or Kubernetes config map

. It is helpful for teams with Sourcegraph as a critical piece of infrastructure, to be able to check the Sourcegraph configuration into version control. We received feedback that it would be nice to be able to make temporary edits in the web UI and diverge from the files on disk intentionally (i.e., to try an option out before committing it).
to allow the active Sourcegraph configuration to diverge from the file, thus allowing temporary edits. For complete details, see

Indexed search now supports symbol queries. This feature will require re-indexing all repositories. This will increase the disk and memory usage of indexed search by roughly 10%. You can disable the feature with the configuration
Multi-line search now works for non-indexed search.
to allow edits to be made to the config in the application which will be overwritten on the next process restart.
Out-of-the-box TypeScript code intelligence is much better with an updated ctags version with a built-in TypeScript parser.
Sourcegraph uses Git protocol version 2 for increased efficiency and performance when fetching data from compatible code hosts.
are faster at finding repository matches.
Zoekt now runs with GOGC=50 by default, helping to reduce the memory consumption of Sourcegraph.
Upgraded the version of Go in use, which improves security for publicly accessible Sourcegraph instances.
Disk cleanup in gitserver is now done in terms of percentages to fix

Fixed an issue where search would sometimes crash with a panic due to a nil pointer.
Fixed Phabricator external services so they won‚Äôt stop the syncing process for repositories when Phabricator doesn‚Äôt return clone URLs.
